conclusion: Use the first law of thermodynamics to relate internal energy change, heat transfer, and work done.
p-V diagram shows a state change from A to C with pressure change from 3 × 10^5 Pa to 1 × 10^5 Pa and volume change from 4 × 10^(-3) m^3 to 1 × 10^(-3) m^3.
Calculate work done using the formula W = ∫ p dV since pressure is not constant.
Calculate work for isothermal expansion: W = p_A V_A ln(V_C/V_A).
Substitute values into the work formula: W = 1200 × ln(0.25).
Use first law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W with ΔU = 200 J.
Verify that the standard answer is 1860.8 J.
